title: 103_s1178
content: The Act may be cited as the "Great Lakes Federal Effectiveness Act" and establishes the Great Lakes Research Council. The Great Lakes Research Council is established to advise and coordinate Federal research activities for ecosystem protection of the Great Lakes. Within one year of enactment, the Council will assess research needs and Federal expertise to fulfill the Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement goals. The Great Lakes Research Council is tasked with assessing research needs and Federal expertise to fulfill the Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement goals. They are also responsible for identifying topics for meetings, making recommendations for data collection, and advising on the establishment of research protocols for the Great Lakes ecosystem. The Great Lakes Research Council aims to enhance research and management protocols for the Great Lakes ecosystem. They advise on establishing a comprehensive data base and ensure timely dissemination of research findings. The Council is comprised of research managers from various agencies, including the Environmental Protection Agency. The Great Lakes Research Council consists of research managers from agencies like the Environmental Protection Agency, National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, United States Coast Guard, United States Fish and Wildlife Service, and other relevant federal departments. Non-Federal employees can also serve as ex officio members. The Chairperson is elected by members for a two-year term, with a limit of two consecutive terms. Members are entitled to compensation while performing official duties. Members of the Great Lakes Research Council are entitled to compensation for travel expenses while performing official duties. Federal departments must cooperate with the Council to implement recommendations and provide necessary assistance upon request. The Great Lakes Research Council members are entitled to travel expense compensation. The Council invites the International Joint Commission to coordinate activities and may reimburse costs. The Act does not affect the authority of federal agencies for Great Lakes research. Sec. 105 defines key terms related to the Great Lakes, including the Great Lakes Research Council, the Great Lakes ecosystem, and the Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement. The Great Lakes Water Quality Agreement is a bilateral agreement between the United States and Canada signed in 1978 and amended in 1987.
